info.title: SAR-API - OneAtlas Radar
info.description:
REST API to search, order and access TerraSAR and PAZ Data (Radar API)
Those commands can be used to test and understand the services provided by the APIs. You can use them in a third party application such as Postman.

tags.name: sar/config
tags.description: Endpoint for SAR specific user configuration.

tags.name: sar/search
tags.description: Endpoint to search for possible SAR acquisitions.

tags.name: sar/prices
tags.description: Query the price of an SAR acquisition.

tags.name: sar/editing
tags.description: Endpoint to modify an SAR acquisition.

tags.name: sar/baskets
tags.description: Handle your baskets to order SAR acquisitions.

get.summary: Return account information of the current user

pw_change_needed.description: This flag is set if the password has been (re)set by the system or flagged for some other reason (e.g. if security standards have changed). It is unrelated to the password expiration date.

pw_expiration_date.description: If the password of this account is set to expire, this is the end date (included) until which the password can be used to log in without being changed

expiration_date.description: End date (included) until which the user is able to log in

registration_status.description: This flag is only set if the account isn't fully registered

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: A Token used as substitute of 'oldPassword' (e.g. for a password reset). Note: you might need to set 'oldPassword' to an empty string.

oldPassword.description: Base64 encoded Password. The plain text Password must have a minimal length of 15 characters, lower and uppercase letters, at least one number and special character.

password.description: Base64 encoded Password. The plain text Password must have a minimal length of 15 characters, lower and uppercase letters, at least one number and special character.

post.summary: search for possible acquisitions for tasking

priority.description: Higher priority orders have a better chance of success but incur an additional fee

feasibilityLevel.description: Level of feasibility for the search

periodicity.description: If set a datastack search will be performed. There will be up to 3 footprints with datastacks (grouped by groupId) taking periodicity and occerrences into account.

occurrences.description: If set: Number of times a scene should be acquired. This parameter will only be used if periodicity is set and can be used for the acquisition of datastacks.

sensorMode.description: The imaging/instrument/sensor mode to use for the acquisition

polarizationChannels.description: The dual-polarization modes (HHVV, HHHV, VVVH) are not available for staring spotlight or (wide) ScanSAR modes. The polarization modes HV and VH are only available for Wide ScanSAR acquisitions.

incidenceAngle.description: Incidence angle range in degrees. Only acquisitions with an average incidence angle in this range will be considered.

lookDirection.description: Look Direction. Left-looking acquisitions require special authorization.

outOfFullPerformance.description: If set to true and the account is authorized, out of full performance scenes will be included in the response.

customer.description: name of the user's end customer (only relevant for resellers)

productType.description: Product type for the processing of the acuqisition. Mandatory on placing the order, but not for feasibility.

resolutionVariant.description: Radiometric or spatial enhancement. Mandatory on placing the order, but not for feasibility.

acquisitionOnly.description: Acquisition is done and archived, but product will not be processed and deliverd. Requires special authorization.

receivingStation.description: Downlink station to use for direct-access customers

orbitType.description: Near Realtime acquisitions will incur an additional fee. Science processing is most accurate but takes approx 5 days to complete. Mandatory on placing the order, but not for feasibility.

geocodedIncidenceMask.description: Include GIM in delivered product. Only applicable for EEC products.

mapProjection.description: Projection of the delivered product. Mandatory on placing the order, but not for feasibility.

gainAttenuation.description: Processor gain Attenuation. Mandatory on placing the order, but not for feasibility.

minimumCoverage.description: Minimum percentage of the acquisition that has to be covered by the search AOI for it to be considered a match.

beamId.description: Restrict search results to acquisitions with the given elevation beams. This search parameter is supported for the swath-modes Stripmap, ScanSAR, and Wide ScanSAR only.

oneOf.description: Identifier of the elevation beam. For a comprehensive characterization of each elevation beam please see the TerraSAR-X basic product specification.

items.description: Identifier of the elevation beam. For a comprehensive characterization of each elevation beam please see the TerraSAR-X basic product specification.

relativeOrbit.description: Restrict search results to acquisitions with the given relative orbit numbers. Note that the relative orbit numbers of the TerraSAR-X and PAZ missions are not equivalent.

oneOf.description: Relative orbit number at the start of the acquisition. Note that the relative orbit numbers of the TerraSAR-X and PAZ missions are not equivalent.

items.description: Relative orbit number at the start of the acquisition. Note that the relative orbit numbers of the TerraSAR-X and PAZ missions are not equivalent.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Continuation token used to retrieve the next set of datatakes. Tokens do not expire and can be used for incremental updates on a weekly, daily, or even on a hourly schedule.

get.description: Replicate the catalogue and retrieve latest datatakes.

beamId.description: Identifier of the elevation beam. For a comprehensive characterization of each elevation beam please see the TerraSAR-X basic product specification.

incidenceAngle.description: Incidence angle range in degrees. Only acquisitions with an average incidence angle in this range will be considered.

lookDirection.description: Look Direction. Left-looking acquisitions require special authorization.

outOfFullPerformance.description: If set to true and the account is authorized, out of full performance scenes will be included in the response.

polarizationChannels.description: The dual-polarization modes (HHVV, HHHV, VVVH) are not available for staring spotlight or (wide) ScanSAR modes. The polarization modes HV and VH are only available for Wide ScanSAR acquisitions.

relativeOrbit.description: Relative orbit number at the start of the acquisition. Note that the relative orbit numbers of the TerraSAR-X and PAZ missions are not equivalent.

sensorMode.description: The imaging/instrument/sensor mode to use for the acquisition

bbox.description: Rectangular bounding box of all geometries within the collection. The members of the array are minLon, minLat, maxLon, and maxLat; i.e. the coordinates of the southwesterly point followed by the coordinates of the northeasterly point.

401.description: Authorization information is missing or invalid.

503.description: Catalogue replication is temporarily not available.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of revocations to be returned per request. The actual number returned can be less depending on the workload of the server.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: Return revocations issued since the given date.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Continuation token used to retrieve the next set of revocations. Tokens do not expire and can be used for incremental updates on a weekly, daily, or even on a hourly schedule.

get.description: Retrieve catalogue revocations, i.e. catalogue datatakes that cannot be ordered anymore.

401.description: Authorization information is missing or invalid.

503.description: Catalogue revocations are temporarily not available.

bbox.description: Rectangular bounding box of all geometries within the collection. The members of the array are minLon, minLat, maxLon, and maxLat; i.e. the coordinates of the southwesterly point followed by the coordinates of the northeasterly point.

default.description: Response status codes are not evaluated by the SAR-API. In case of client or server errors, no further attempts to send a update notification are made.

notifyEndpoint.description: Endpoint for asynchronous update notifications. Set this parameter to a HTTP or HTTPS URL to subscribe to update notifications after submitting an order. To unsubscribe, set this parameter to null. HTTP basic authentication is supported by providing username and password within the URL itself (i.e. https://username:password@example.org). More sophisticated methods of authentication like OAuth are not supported.

purpose.description: Order purpose. Mandatory on submitting the shopcart, but not on crate.

sensorMode.description: The imaging/instrument/sensor mode to use for the acquisition

polarizationChannels.description: The dual-polarization modes (HHVV, HHHV, VVVH) are not available for staring spotlight or (wide) ScanSAR modes. The polarization modes HV and VH are only available for Wide ScanSAR acquisitions.

beamId.description: Identifier of the elevation beam. For a comprehensive characterization of each elevation beam please see the TerraSAR-X basic product specification.

lookDirection.description: Look Direction. Left-looking acquisitions require special authorization.

incidenceAngle.description: Incidence angle range in degrees. Only acquisitions with an average incidence angle in this range will be considered.

resolutionVariant.description: Radiometric or spatial enhancement. Mandatory on placing the order, but not for feasibility.

orbitType.description: Near Realtime acquisitions will incur an additional fee. Science processing is most accurate but takes approx 5 days to complete. Mandatory on placing the order, but not for feasibility.

geocodedIncidenceMask.description: Include GIM in delivered product. Only applicable for EEC products.

mapProjection.description: Projection of the delivered product. Mandatory on placing the order, but not for feasibility.

gainAttenuation.description: Processor gain Attenuation. Mandatory on placing the order, but not for feasibility.

post.description: Notifications are send as soon as updates become available within the SAR-API. If multiple items are updated within a short period of time, they may be grouped into a single notification request. The ordering of multiple items within a update notification request is undefined.

parameters.description: Unique value generated by the SAR-API to help recognizing subsequent retries of the same update notification request. The value will never be reused with another update notification request of different content.
parameters.name: Idempotency-Key

parameters.description: Origin of the update notification request. This is the address of the SAR-API itself.

post.summary: reorder items with other order options
post.description: Reordering of items with different order options or order templates. Reorders await the availability of all of their items within the catalog, i.e. they can be submitted before an acquisition takes place. Once all items are available, reorders are automatically submitted. Note that reorders are automatically cancelled once the procurement of any item failed or is being cancelled in another way.

geocodedIncidenceMask.description: Include GIM in delivered product. Only applicable for EEC products.

mapProjection.description: Projection of the delivered product. Mandatory on placing the order, but not for feasibility.

gainAttenuation.description: Processor gain Attenuation. Mandatory on placing the order, but not for feasibility.

relativeOrbit.description: Relative orbit number at the start of the acquisition. Note that the relative orbit numbers of the TerraSAR-X and PAZ missions are not equivalent.

customer.description: name of the user's end customer (only relevant for resellers)

status.description: Status of item

missingParameters.description: parameters that need to be set to get a definite sensitivity status

outOfFullPerformance.description: If set to true and the account is authorized, out of full performance scenes will be included in the response.

acquisitionOnly.description: Acquisition is done and archived, but product will not be processed and deliverd. Requires special authorization.

priority.description: Higher priority orders have a better chance of success but incur an additional fee

receivingStation.description: Downlink station to use for direct-access customers

final.description: Not final, if parameters are missing to calculate all price elements (e.g. Fees). Final price might then be higher.

missingParameters.description: parameters that need to be set to get final price

total.description: Price for item including discounts and fees. Taxes are __not__ included.

discountRate.description: Discount for this item in percent
Discount rate applied on fee in percent

orderSubmissionTime.description: The time at which the corresponding order has been submitted.

bbox.description: Rectangular bounding box of all geometries within the collection. The members of the array are minLon, minLat, maxLon, and maxLat; i.e. the coordinates of the southwesterly point followed by the coordinates of the northeasterly point.

401.description: Authorization information is missing or invalid.

post.description: Cancellation of already ordered items. Future items may be cancelled up until their submission deadline. Cancelling within 72 hours of the submission deadline may incur a cancellation fee. The cancellation of catalog items is not supported.

200.description: Cancellation results. It may take a short time before a cancelled status is reflected on the cancelled items. A failed status has no effect on the items to be cancelled.

401.description: Authorization information is missing or invalid.

get.description: Inquire the health status of the web service and its dependent components. A positive response indicates the readiness use the API to its full extent.

default.description: Health responses are modeled according to the Health Check Response Format proposed by the IETF working group. The HTTP response status code is either within the 2xx range or the 5xx range depending on the actual health status.

get.description: Inquire the availability of the web service. A positive response indicates the readiness to process incoming requests.

204.description: Web service is ready to process incoming requests.

503.description: Web service is unable to process incoming request.
